programme.title: Piłka nożna: Liga angielska - mecz: Liverpool FC - Southampton FC
programme.desc: Nastoletni Dani, Sam, Illyana Rasputin, Bobby i Rahne obdarzeni są niezwykłymi mocami. Przebywają w specjalnym ośrodku prowadzonym przez doktor Cecilię Reyes. Młodzi ludzie mają nauczyć się panować nad swoimi zdolnościami, które są dla nich przekleństwem. Z czasem nabierają wątpliwości co do intencji swoich opiekunów.

programme.title: The New Mutants
Nowi mutanci
The New Mutants
programme.desc: The New Mutants: Directed by Josh Boone. With Maisie Williams, Anya Taylor-Joy, Charlie Heaton, Alice Braga. Five young mutants, just discovering their abilities while held in a secret facility against their will, fight to escape their past sins and save themselves." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4682266/","name":"The New Mutants","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ2NTdmNDgtMGIwMS00ODE2LTk5M2EtZGZhYzc4MWRlNTU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc4MjczMTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Five young mutants, just discovering their abilities while held in a secret facility against their will, fight to escape their past sins and save themselves.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4682266/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sara-691"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"This movie desperately needed whatever they edited out.","reviewBody":"It was an OK movie all in all, but it could've been SO much better. I was personally stoked for a horror mutants movie, but this is as much horror as any other superhero movie (and less than some) so I must say I was very disappointed. The idea of was there and it could've been SO SO good but in the end, it wasn't...\n\nA thing that really distracted me was the actors weird accents. You have a group of really good actors here but the bad accents made them just seem mediocre.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":68455,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2020-08-28","keywords":"mutant,based on comic book,marvel comics,x men,superheroine","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Comic-Con Teaser","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1041219097","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmIyNDQxZDgtNTY0NS00ZDcxLTkwNDgtYjQ1ZGI0NGU2ODcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmIyNDQxZDgtNTY0NS00ZDcxLTkwNDgtYjQ1ZGI0NGU2ODcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Twentieth Century Studios in association with Marvel Entertainment presents The New Mutants, an original horror thriller set in an isolated hospital where a group of young mutants is being held for psychiatric monitoring. When strange occurrences begin to take place, both their new mutant abilities and their friendships will be tested as they battle to try and make it out alive. Directed by Josh Boone (The Fault in our Stars) and written by Josh Boone & Knate Lee, The New Mutants stars: Maisie Williams (Game of Thrones); Anya Taylor-Joy (Glass); Charlie Heaton (Stranger Things); Alice Braga (Predators); Blu Hunt (The Originals); and Henry Zaga (13 Reasons Why). The film is produced by Simon Kinberg, p.g.a., Karen Rosenfelt and Lauren Shuler Donner with Stan Lee and Michele Imperato Stabile serving as executive producers."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3586035/","name":"Maisie Williams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5896355/","name":"Anya Taylor-Joy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6390427/","name":"Charlie Heaton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1837748/","name":"Josh Boone"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0781821/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0566686/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047120/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1837748/","name":"Josh Boone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1029878/","name":"Knate Lee"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: You May Kiss the Bridesmaid
You May Kiss the Bridesmaid
programme.desc: You May Kiss the Bridesmaid: Directed by Caroline Labrèche. With Tori Anderson, Kristopher Turner, Julia Borsellino, Sarah Orenstein. Food influencer Scarlett Bailey is presented with the opportunity of a lifetime to work as a pastry chef in one of NYC's top restaurants. Her life gets put on hold when she returns to her hometown for her sister Maddie's wedding. Scarlett learns that her parents have sold the family home, a B&B, to her childhood flame Liam Perry and that Maddie has lost her wedding venue days before the nuptials. Scarlett suggests they host the event at the B&B and works with Liam to pull off the wedding of Maddie's dreams, trying to put their history behind them. As her dream job in NYC becomes a firm offer, Scarlett is forced to make a decision. She has been falling back in love with Liam and with her childhood home. With the countdown to the wedding day on, will Liam Perry get to kiss the bridesmaid?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12829388/","name":"You May Kiss the Bridesmaid","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWI3MTQwNzgtYmIzNy00YWI3LWIxMGEtYmE5YmU1YmVmN2RmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk1NzUwMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Food influencer Scarlett Bailey is presented with the opportunity of a lifetime to work as a pastry chef in one of NYC's top restaurants. programme.title: Shadow in the Cloud
Obcy pasażer
Shadow in the Cloud
programme.desc:
Shadow in the Cloud: Directed by Roseanne Liang. With Chloë Grace Moretz, Nick Robinson, Beulah Koale, Taylor John Smith. A female WWII pilot traveling with top secret documents on a B-17 Flying Fortress encounters an evil presence on board the flight." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9691136/","name":"Shadow in the Cloud","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNiNGQyMzUtN2VmMi00NDI2LWI3NGUtMTEwZGQxYzFjZTNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyNDk3MjY3._V1_.jpg","description":"A female WWII pilot traveling with top secret documents on a B-17 Flying Fortress encounters an evil presence on board the flight.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9691136/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TxMike"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Kick-Ass grown up, in WW2, and Rod Serling would be proud.","reviewBody":"The old Twilight Zone TV shows, remember the monster on the airplane wing? This movie does that old TV series proud.

Most of the very bad ratings here are given by viewers who somehow took this for a serious movie. It is not. It is a spoof of sorts, of the competent hard-working women of WW2, and the old signs cautioning workers to avoid gremlins. Here the gremlins are real, they are dangerous, and a super woman of sorts has to save the day.

Chloë Grace Moretz ten years earlier starred in Kick Ass, another movie not to be taken too seriously. Here she is Maude Garrett who boards a military flight out of New Zealand in 1943, presenting "orders" that she is supposed to be there with a top secret package.

This movie is about as real as the old Bugs Bunny and Roadrunner cartoons. I was invested all the way and found it to be entertaining, fun escapism. That's all it is. Moretz is great.

At home on DVD from my public library, my wife skipped."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22359,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Horror","War"],"datePublished":"2021-01-01","keywords":"boeing b 17 flying fortress,world war two,electronic music score,1940s,year 1943","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Teaser","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3659972889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNThlYWYxY2UtZTQxMy00ZjkyLWExNDMtMjc4MDAzMThmZTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNThlYWYxY2UtZTQxMy00ZjkyLWExNDMtMjc4MDAzMThmZTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"A female WWII pilot traveling with top secret documents on a B-17 Flying Fortress encounters an evil presence on board the flight."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1631269/","name":"Chloë Grace Moretz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3538718/","name":"Nick Robinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3872230/","name":"Beulah Koale"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1755396/","name":"Roseanne Liang"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0308127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0628817/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0484840/","name":"Max Landis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1755396/","name":"Roseanne Liang"}],"duration":"PT1H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Midnight Express
Midnight Express
programme.desc: Midnight Express: Directed by Alan Parker. With Brad Davis, Irene Miracle, Bo Hopkins, Paolo Bonacelli. Billy Hayes, an American college student, is caught smuggling drugs out of Turkey and thrown into prison." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0077928/","name":"Midnight Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDU1MjQ0YWMtMWQ2MS00NTdmLTg1MGItNDA5NTNkNTRhOTIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Billy Hayes, an American college student, is caught smuggling drugs out of Turkey and thrown into prison.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0077928/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"yenlo"},"dateCreated":"2002-10-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"When you're busted for drugs over there!","reviewBody":"While this film is entertaining to watch and has its level of suspense at various points it is not a truly `true story' much of it according to the real Billy Hayes never happened and his eventual escape is very different from what is depicted in this motion picture. It also tends to demonize the nation of Turkey and presents a distorted view of its people. Is it possible to have sympathy for the main character? He was fully aware of what he was doing and knew the consequences should he be caught so sympathy is on an individual basis. You may have sympathy or may not.\n\n A number of years ago a public service commercial narrated by actor Hal Holbrook frequently ran on Television, which told of Americans being held in foreign prisons. He spoke of one American held in a Turkish prison. Was it Billy Hayes? The commercial ends with the line `When you're busted for drugs over there you're in for the hassle of your life' That's the message this film was intended to send out irregardless if the events in it were true or fictionalized for dramatic purposes. As always purchase or rent a copy to see the uncut unedited version."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":77185,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1978-08-10","keywords":"watching someone masturbate,social masturbation,gay kiss,bare chested male,1970s","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Midnight Express","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2878734617","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWZhOTI3M2EtNGJlZC00OGY5LTk4YjgtOGZkZGE3MTY3ZTE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWZhOTI3M2EtNGJlZC00OGY5LTk4YjgtOGZkZGE3MTY3ZTE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001113/","name":"Brad Davis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0591968/","name":"Irene Miracle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005019/","name":"Bo Hopkins"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000570/","name":"Alan Parker"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0032235/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000231/","name":"Oliver Stone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0370907/","name":"Billy Hayes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0388772/","name":"William Hoffer"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: A Vida Invisível
Niewidoczne życie sióstr Gusmao
A Vida Invisível de Eurídice Gusmão
programme.desc:
A Vida Invisível: Directed by Karim Aïnouz. With Julia Stockler, Carol Duarte, Flávia Gusmão, António Fonseca. Kept apart by a terrible lie and a conservative society, two sisters born in Rio de Janeiro make their way through life each believing the other is living out her dreams half a world away." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6390668/","name":"A Vida Invisível","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzI4ZGExYTctMTRlZS00MzgzLWI1NTktYzk5ODkzOWNlZjc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkzODUwNzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Kept apart by a terrible lie and a conservative society, two sisters born in Rio de Janeiro make their way through life each believing the other is living out her dreams half a world away.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6390668/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"the strength of separated sisters","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. Masterful storytelling when combined with expert filmmaking is a treasure to be appreciated and enjoyed, even if the story is not so pleasant. Such is the case with this gem from writer-director Karim Ainouz, who adapted the screenplay with Murilo Hauser and Ines Bortagaray from the novel "The Invisible Life of Euridice Gusmao" by Martha Bathala. Based in Rio de Janiero, the film blends the vibrant colors of the area with the traditional and restrictive Latin American family expectations of the 1950's.

The story spans 5 or 6 decades, and when we first meet sisters Euridice and Guida, it's clear they share a tight emotional bond that goes deeper than blood. Though their personalities differ greatly, they are both ahead of their time and out of step with the conventions of the era. Euridice (a strong performance by Carol Duarte) longs for independence and aspires to be a concert pianist after a hoped-for Conservatory in Vienna, while Guida (a powerhouse Julia Stockler) is a dreamer seeking true love, and whose party girl ways must be kept hidden from their conservative father. Both young ladies are spirited, yet respectful.

Their lives are forever altered when Guida runs off to Greece with her sailor lover. As is too often the case with young dreamers, she returns home once her spontaneous choices prove to be poor judgment. Her father rejects his pregnant daughter since, in his eyes, she has disgraced the family. The parents mislead Guida about her sister's whereabouts, so Guida assumes Euridice is off at conservatory fulfilling her dreams. This sets Guida off on her own solitary path.

In actuality, Euridice has married and experienced one of the worst ever wedding nights, featuring what is likely cinema's most unsexy bathroom lovemaking scene. There is an element of horror films to this segment of the film, as the sisters are living their worst nightmares, while being separated from each other ... unable to communicate. The male-dominated Latin culture and family traditions prevent their mother from 'disobeying' the father's order, so the cruel lie continues as the sisters unknowingly live their lives within the same town. There is even one excruciatingly painful-to-watch scene that finds them in the same restaurant at the same time, yet oblivious to the presence of the other.

Each woman's inner-strength pushes them forward. Guida (now Gisele) befriends a wise former prostitute Filomena (an excellent Barbara Santos) who becomes her mentor in poverty. Euridice tries to make the best of her situation while keeping her dream alive. Mostly what we have is a tragic story without one specific tragedy - other than the daughter spurned by her father. There are so many moments of pain and frustration, with undelivered mail being among the worst. The film is beautifully shot by cinematographer Helene Louvart, and it reminds us that 'life happens', and it's not all love and Bach. This is an emotional and heart-breaking story, and devotees of The Lifetime Channel will likely be disappointed in the ending. For me, I have no qualms about the emotional wringer the film puts viewers through - even after the opening scene foreshadowing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7456,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-11-21","keywords":"male full frontal nudity,erection,male explicit nudity,erect penis,uncircumcised penis","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3375480601","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjNhMDI1ZTYtNzU2Ny00NGIzLTlmN2MtYjg4OGY0MjUxNzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjNhMDI1ZTYtNzU2Ny00NGIzLTlmN2MtYjg4OGY0MjUxNzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Rio de Janeiro, 1950. Eurídice, 18, and Guida, 20, are two inseparable sisters living at home with their conservative parents. Although immersed in a traditional life, each one nourishes a dream: Eurídice of becoming a renowned pianist, Guida of finding true love. In a dramatic turn, they are separated by their father and forced to live apart. They take control of their separate destinies, while never giving up hope of finding each other. A tropical melodrama from the director of Madame Satã."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3126686/","name":"Julia Stockler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6706672/","name":"Carol Duarte"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1411240/","name":"Flávia Gusmão"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0014694/","name":"Karim Aïnouz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0245671/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0133296/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0258481/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2675515/","name":"Murilo Hauser"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1972905/","name":"Inés Bortagaray"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0014694/","name":"Karim Aïnouz"}],"duration":"PT2H19M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
21 Jump Street
programme.desc:
21 Jump Street: Directed by Phil Lord, Christopher Miller. With Jonah Hill, Channing Tatum, Brie Larson, Dave Franco. A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1232829/","name":"21 Jump Street","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTZjNzRjMTMtZDMzNy00Y2ZjLTg0OTAtZjVhNzYyZmJjOTljXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE5NzE3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1232829/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CraigLindholmMedia"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Touche...","reviewBody":"Precursor: I just moved back into town two days ago and had made plans to see one of my old friends tonight. I did not want to see this movie, and wouldn't have under any other circumstances but my friend really wanted to and the tickets were free so I went. 

Review itself: This is of no disrespect to Jonah Hill, his fashion of humor or his fans at all, but I, personally have grown tired of what seems to now be a plethora of wanna be Hangover and Superbad's. (The success of Project X seriously worries me...). Anyways, having that mind set approaching tonight and considering the fact I didn't laugh once during the 21 JS trailer, green or red band... I really wasn't expecting all that much out of the experience aside from leaving the house and catching up with a buddy. 

But damn. 

I honestly thought this movie was great. Yes, there were parts I wasn't fond of... a bit of the dialogue seemed to me to be vulgar strictly for the sake of being vulgar... there was the usual expected Jonah Hill trademarked myriad of penis jokes and one extremely unnecessary shock gag but the majority of the movie was, to me, surprisingly satirical/smart/relevant in today's society, self-aware, and situationally hilarious. Even the dumbest and most profane of this movie's jokes and clichés seemed to know that they were such and were given the proper comedic build up/context to at least warrant a chuckle. This movie had some surprisingly clever dialogue throughout and some of the best supporting characters I've seen in recent comedies (Ice Cube, The Principal, etc..) What really stood out to me though was the editing. 21 Jump Street features some of the most awkwardly humorous camera shot transitions, scene changes and music integration. Despite it's faults, I found this to be a damn hard movie to hate, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun weekend movie.

All in all... genuine, clever, vulgar yet respectable comedy with some heart. 

IMO a very good career move for both Hill and Tatum. 

Stoked for the sequel.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":533050,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2012-04-25","keywords":"undercover cop,underage drinking,remake,buddy movie,jock","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1681366553","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwNzI4MDUzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjE4MDIwNw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwNzI4MDUzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjE4MDIwNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school in order to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1706767/","name":"Jonah Hill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475594/","name":"Channing Tatum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001084/","name":"Ice Cube"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0520488/","name":"Phil Lord"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0588087/","name":"Christopher Miller"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0045209/","name":"Michael Bacall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1706767/","name":"Jonah Hill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367895/","name":"Patrick Hasburgh"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1232829, Title: 21 Jump Street, --- Description: 21 Jump Street: Directed by Phil Lord, Christopher Miller. With Jonah Hill, Channing Tatum, Brie Larson, Dave Franco. A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1232829/","name":"21 Jump Street","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTZjNzRjMTMtZDMzNy00Y2ZjLTg0OTAtZjVhNzYyZmJjOTljXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE5NzE3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1232829/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"CraigLindholmMedia","dateCreated":"2012-03-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Touche...","reviewBody":"Precursor: I just moved back into town two days ago and had made plans to see one of my old friends tonight. I did not want to see this movie, and wouldn't have under any other circumstances but my friend really wanted to and the tickets were free so I went. 

Review itself: This is of no disrespect to Jonah Hill, his fashion of humor or his fans at all, but I, personally have grown tired of what seems to now be a plethora of wanna be Hangover and Superbad's. (The success of Project X seriously worries me...). Anyways, having that mind set approaching tonight and considering the fact I didn't laugh once during the 21 JS trailer, green or red band... I really wasn't expecting all that much out of the experience aside from leaving the house and catching up with a buddy. 

But damn. 

I honestly thought this movie was great. Yes, there were parts I wasn't fond of... a bit of the dialogue seemed to me to be vulgar strictly for the sake of being vulgar... there was the usual expected Jonah Hill trademarked myriad of penis jokes and one extremely unnecessary shock gag but the majority of the movie was, to me, surprisingly satirical/smart/relevant in today's society, self-aware, and situationally hilarious. Even the dumbest and most profane of this movie's jokes and clichés seemed to know that they were such and were given the proper comedic build up/context to at least warrant a chuckle. This movie had some surprisingly clever dialogue throughout and some of the best supporting characters I've seen in recent comedies (Ice Cube, The Principal, etc..) What really stood out to me though was the editing. 21 Jump Street features some of the most awkwardly humorous camera shot transitions, scene changes and music integration. Despite it's faults, I found this to be a damn hard movie to hate, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun weekend movie.

All in all... genuine, clever, vulgar yet respectable comedy with some heart. 

IMO a very good career move for both Hill and Tatum. 

Stoked for the sequel.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":533050,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2012-04-25","keywords":"undercover cop,underage drinking,remake,buddy movie,jock","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1681366553","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwNzI4MDUzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjE4MDIwNw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwNzI4MDUzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjE4MDIwNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school in order to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1706767/","name":"Jonah Hill","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475594/","name":"Channing Tatum","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001084/","name":"Ice Cube"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0520488/","name":"Phil Lord","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0588087/","name":"Christopher Miller"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0045209/","name":"Michael Bacall","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1706767/","name":"Jonah Hill","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367895/","name":"Patrick Hasburgh"],"duration":"PT1H49M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Phil Lord, Christopher Miller

A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1232829/","name":"21 Jump Street","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTZjNzRjMTMtZDMzNy00Y2ZjLTg0OTAtZjVhNzYyZmJjOTljXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE5NzE3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1232829/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CraigLindholmMedia"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Touche...","reviewBody":"Precursor: I just moved back into town two days ago and had made plans to see one of my old friends tonight. I did not want to see this movie, and wouldn't have under any other circumstances but my friend really wanted to and the tickets were free so I went. 

Review itself: This is of no disrespect to Jonah Hill, his fashion of humor or his fans at all, but I, personally have grown tired of what seems to now be a plethora of wanna be Hangover and Superbad's. (The success of Project X seriously worries me...). Anyways, having that mind set approaching tonight and considering the fact I didn't laugh once during the 21 JS trailer, green or red band... I really wasn't expecting all that much out of the experience aside from leaving the house and catching up with a buddy. 

But damn. 

I honestly thought this movie was great. Yes, there were parts I wasn't fond of... a bit of the dialogue seemed to me to be vulgar strictly for the sake of being vulgar... there was the usual expected Jonah Hill trademarked myriad of penis jokes and one extremely unnecessary shock gag but the majority of the movie was, to me, surprisingly satirical/smart/relevant in today's society, self-aware, and situationally hilarious. Even the dumbest and most profane of this movie's jokes and clichés seemed to know that they were such and were given the proper comedic build up/context to at least warrant a chuckle. This movie had some surprisingly clever dialogue throughout and some of the best supporting characters I've seen in recent comedies (Ice Cube, The Principal, etc..) What really stood out to me though was the editing. 21 Jump Street features some of the most awkwardly humorous camera shot transitions, scene changes and music integration. Despite it's faults, I found this to be a damn hard movie to hate, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun weekend movie.

All in all... genuine, clever, vulgar yet respectable comedy with some heart. 

IMO a very good career move for both Hill and Tatum.

Review itself: This is of no disrespect to Jonah Hill, his fashion of humor or his fans at all, but I, personally have grown tired of what seems to now be a plethora of wanna be Hangover and Superbad's. (The success of Project X seriously worries me...). Anyways, having that mind set approaching tonight and considering the fact I didn't laugh once during the 21 JS trailer, green or red band... I really wasn't expecting all that much out of the experience aside from leaving the house and catching up with a buddy. 

But damn. 

I honestly thought this movie was great. Yes, there were parts I wasn't fond of... a bit of the dialogue seemed to me to be vulgar strictly for the sake of being vulgar... there was the usual expected Jonah Hill trademarked myriad of penis jokes and one extremely unnecessary shock gag but the majority of the movie was, to me, surprisingly satirical/smart/relevant in today's society, self-aware, and situationally hilarious. Even the dumbest and most profane of this movie's jokes and clichés seemed to know that they were such and were given the proper comedic build up/context to at least warrant a chuckle. IMO a very good career move for both Hill and Tatum.

programme.title: Ostatnia wyprawa
Dernière ligne droite
programme.desc: Zatrudniony w firmie kurierskiej Chuck (Tom Hanks) jest pochłonięty robieniem kariery. Zaniedbuje przy tym swoją narzeczoną. Podczas jednej z podróży służbowych samolot, którym leci mężczyzna, rozbija się. On jako jedyny uchodzi z życiem. Morze wyrzuca go na brzeg bezludnej wyspy. Rozbitek spędza tu cztery lata. Wreszcie w desperacji buduje tratwę i wyrusza po śmierć lub ocalenie. Szczęście mu sprzyja i niebawem zostaje odnaleziony. Powrót do dawnego życia okazuje się trudny.

programme.title: Cast Away
Cast Away - poza światem
Cast Away
programme.desc: Cast Away: Directed by Robert Zemeckis. With Paul Sanchez, Lari White, Leonid Citer, David Allen Brooks. A FedEx executive undergoes a physical and emotional transformation after crash landing on a deserted island." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0162222/","name":"Cast Away","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2Y5ZTU4YjctMDRmMC00MTg4LWE1M2MtMjk4MzVmOTE4YjkzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc1NTQxODI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A FedEx executive undergoes a physical and emotional transformation after crash landing on a deserted island.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0162222/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mjcmike1"},"dateCreated":"2012-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"The most deserving film not in the top 250","reviewBody":"This movie is the most deserving of all movies out there that is not in the IMDb Top 250. In fact, this movie should be in the Top 100. Everything about it works, the cinematography, the locations, the acting, the story and this is Robert Zemeckis' greatest showpiece. Tom Hanks has done some bad roles over the years but this is as brilliant as any Jimmy Stewart performance captured on film. I revisit this film about once a year and find things about it that make it even better with each viewing. The story is so well written in its simplicity, and Helen Hunt and Hanks have an amazing chemistry. It is a love story with action and heartbreak like few films have been able to pull together. I guarantee you will never pass a Wilson volleyball again without a big smile!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":557254,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2001-02-07","keywords":"survival,crash survivor,remote island,talking to an inanimate object,lost at sea","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi127449625","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWY3MGY2ODktY2NkOC00NTljLTk0YmMtZWUyYmVlMTVkZWY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1hcmNtYW5u._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWY3MGY2ODktY2NkOC00NTljLTk0YmMtZWUyYmVlMTVkZWY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1hcmNtYW5u._V1_.jpg","description":"The official trailer for 'Cast Away' starring Tom Hanks."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000166/","name":"Helen Hunt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0584052/","name":"Paul Sanchez"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0038131/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0115310/","name":"William Broyles Jr."}],"duration":"PT2H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: You Only Live Twice
Żyje się tylko dwa razy
You Only Live Twice
programme.desc:
You Only Live Twice: Directed by Lewis Gilbert. With Sean Connery, Akiko Wakabayashi, Mie Hama, Tetsurô Tanba. James Bond and the Japanese Secret Service must find and stop the true culprit of a series of space hijackings, before war is provoked between Russia and the United States." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0062512/","name":"You Only Live Twice","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc5MThlMDMtNGZhNy00ZGI5LTliYjItNmIwMzZlOTliOTNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MTk1ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"James Bond and the Japanese Secret Service must find and stop the true culprit of a series of space hijackings, before war is provoked between Russia and the United States.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0062512/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michaelarmer"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"You Only Shag Four","reviewBody":"This is another very well made Bond film, Sean Connery is up to his usual high standard, and he is ably abetted by Donald Pleasance as Blofeld, it's got all the usual trademarks, good direction, good photography, good music, and good action, particularly the Helicopter battle. It helps that they actually filmed in the places they were supposed to be at, adding quality and authenticity and with Chinese or Japanese actors, the only downside is that they were dubbed. The title song is good, by Nancy Sinatra, but not the best.

Bond Themes: - Live Intro, Silhouette Titles, Casino scene, M, Q & Moneypenny, Spectre, Cars (not Aston martins, Toyota 2000GTs instead), no Belly dancer, no Train scene and no Felix Leiter as well. Henchmen - Hans, played by Ronald Rich and someone who was just a getaway driver but turns out to be well hard, Peter Fanene Maivia from Samoa, also Miss Brandt played by Karin Dor (also a Bond Girl). Gadgets : Little Nellie

Bond Girls, there were 4 in this one, the first was in the Hong Kong intro, Ling (no. 16) played by Tsai Chin (Hong Kong), next was one of two main "Bond Girls" Aki (no.17) played by Japanese actor Akiki Wakabayashi, and very nice too, unfortunately she gets killed later. Then it was Miss Brandt (No.18), played by German actor Karin Dor (a very good actor), she was a baddie, and Bond tries to turn her, but it does not work, she tries to kill 007, making her a Henchwoman as well, but she gets it later, and lastly in this film Kissy (no. 19), the one he marries, and the best looking, she wouldn't have him at first but he nailed her at the end.

And about that marriage, Bond is supposed to have only been married once, in the next to Tracy (Diana Rigg) but he gets married here, it's said to be a fake marriage, but I don't see how, they went through the whole ceremony, the only thing that was fake was his name and his toupee, (I know its make-believe, I am just on about the characters and story), so for me Bond has been married twice and committed bigamy in OHMSS, unless they have annulled it. Oh and in one scene Henderson asks Bond if his Martini/Vodka is "Stirred not Shaken" and Bond agrees, so for true it does not matter how he takes it.

Anyway, it's another solid effort from Connery and the Bond Team, not the best but not far off, I would have given a 9 had they not dubbed most of the oriental's.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":104985,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1967-06-13","keywords":"faked death,secret headquarters,japan,ninja,secret organization","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"These Bond Women Are Changing the Spy Game","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3772365849","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzI0Yjg1NTEtNDk3Zi00MzljLTk5Y2MtNmYwYWNlMTViYzVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzI0Yjg1NTEtNDk3Zi00MzljLTk5Y2MtNmYwYWNlMTViYzVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On this IMDbrief, presented by Progressive, let's look at the evolution of the women who loved the spy, and hear from four who co-star with Daniel Craig in Bond 25."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000125/","name":"Sean Connery"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0906686/","name":"Akiko Wakabayashi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0357240/","name":"Mie Hama"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0318150/","name":"Lewis Gilbert"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0089169/","name":"Harold Jack Bloom"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001094/","name":"Roald Dahl"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001220/","name":"Ian Fleming"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
21 Jump Street
programme.desc:
21 Jump Street: Directed by Phil Lord, Christopher Miller. With Jonah Hill, Channing Tatum, Brie Larson, Dave Franco. A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1232829/","name":"21 Jump Street","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTZjNzRjMTMtZDMzNy00Y2ZjLTg0OTAtZjVhNzYyZmJjOTljXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE5NzE3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1232829/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CraigLindholmMedia"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Touche...","reviewBody":"Precursor: I just moved back into town two days ago and had made plans to see one of my old friends tonight. I did not want to see this movie, and wouldn't have under any other circumstances but my friend really wanted to and the tickets were free so I went. 

Review itself: This is of no disrespect to Jonah Hill, his fashion of humor or his fans at all, but I, personally have grown tired of what seems to now be a plethora of wanna be Hangover and Superbad's. (The success of Project X seriously worries me...). Anyways, having that mind set approaching tonight and considering the fact I didn't laugh once during the 21 JS trailer, green or red band... I really wasn't expecting all that much out of the experience aside from leaving the house and catching up with a buddy. 

But damn. 

I honestly thought this movie was great. Yes, there were parts I wasn't fond of... a bit of the dialogue seemed to me to be vulgar strictly for the sake of being vulgar... there was the usual expected Jonah Hill trademarked myriad of penis jokes and one extremely unnecessary shock gag but the majority of the movie was, to me, surprisingly satirical/smart/relevant in today's society, self-aware, and situationally hilarious. Even the dumbest and most profane of this movie's jokes and clichés seemed to know that they were such and were given the proper comedic build up/context to at least warrant a chuckle. This movie had some surprisingly clever dialogue throughout and some of the best supporting characters I've seen in recent comedies (Ice Cube, The Principal, etc..) What really stood out to me though was the editing. 21 Jump Street features some of the most awkwardly humorous camera shot transitions, scene changes and music integration. Despite it's faults, I found this to be a damn hard movie to hate, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun weekend movie.

All in all... genuine, clever, vulgar yet respectable comedy with some heart. 

IMO a very good career move for both Hill and Tatum. 

Stoked for the sequel.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":533050,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2012-04-25","keywords":"undercover cop,underage drinking,remake,buddy movie,jock","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1681366553","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwNzI4MDUzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjE4MDIwNw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwNzI4MDUzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjE4MDIwNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school in order to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1706767/","name":"Jonah Hill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475594/","name":"Channing Tatum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001084/","name":"Ice Cube"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0520488/","name":"Phil Lord"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0588087/","name":"Christopher Miller"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0045209/","name":"Michael Bacall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1706767/","name":"Jonah Hill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367895/","name":"Patrick Hasburgh"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

I did not want to see this movie, and wouldn't have under any other circumstances but my friend really wanted to and the tickets were free so I went. 

Review itself: This is of no disrespect to Jonah Hill, his fashion of humor or his fans at all, but I, personally have grown tired of what seems to now be a plethora of wanna be Hangover and Superbad's. (The success of Project X seriously worries me...). Anyways, having that mind set approaching tonight and considering the fact I didn't laugh once during the 21 JS trailer, green or red band... I really wasn't expecting all that much out of the experience aside from leaving the house and catching up with a buddy. 

But damn. 

I honestly thought this movie was great. Yes, there were parts I wasn't fond of... a bit of the dialogue seemed to me to be vulgar strictly for the sake of being vulgar... there was the usual expected Jonah Hill trademarked myriad of penis jokes and one extremely unnecessary shock gag but the majority of the movie was, to me, surprisingly satirical/smart/relevant in today's society, self-aware, and situationally hilarious. Even the dumbest and most profane of this movie's jokes and clichés seemed to know that they were such and were given the proper comedic build up/context to at least warrant a chuckle. This movie had some surprisingly clever dialogue throughout and some of the best supporting characters I've seen in recent comedies (Ice Cube, The Principal, etc..) What really stood out to me though was the editing. 21 Jump Street features some of the most awkwardly humorous camera shot transitions, scene changes and music integration. Despite it's faults, I found this to be a damn hard movie to hate, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun weekend movie.

All in all... genuine, clever, vulgar yet respectable comedy with some heart. 

IMO a very good career move for both Hill and Tatum. 

Stoked for the sequel.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":533050,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2012-04-25","keywords":"undercover cop,underage drinking,remake,buddy movie,jock","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1681366553","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwNzI4MDUzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjE4MDIwNw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwNzI4MDUzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjE4MDIwNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school in order to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1706767/","name":"Jonah Hill","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475594/","name":"Channing Tatum","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001084/","name":"Ice Cube"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0520488/","name":"Phil Lord","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0588087/","name":"Christopher Miller"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0045209/","name":"Michael Bacall","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1706767/","name":"Jonah Hill","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367895/","name":"Patrick Hasburgh"],"duration":"PT1H49M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Phil Lord, Christopher Miller

IMDb data; ttnr: 1232829, Title: 21 Jump Street, --- Description: 21 Jump Street: Directed by Phil Lord, Christopher Miller. With Jonah Hill, Channing Tatum, Brie Larson, Dave Franco. A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1232829/","name":"21 Jump Street","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTZjNzRjMTMtZDMzNy00Y2ZjLTg0OTAtZjVhNzYyZmJjOTljXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE5NzE3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1232829/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"CraigLindholmMedia","dateCreated":"2012-03-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Touche...","reviewBody":"Precursor: I just moved back into town two days ago and had made plans to see one of my old friends tonight. I did not want to see this movie, and wouldn't have under any other circumstances but my friend really wanted to and the tickets were free so I went. 

Review itself: This is of no disrespect to Jonah Hill, his fashion of humor or his fans at all, but I, personally have grown tired of what seems to now be a plethora of wanna be Hangover and Superbad's. (The success of Project X seriously worries me...). Anyways, having that mind set approaching tonight and considering the fact I didn't laugh once during the 21 JS trailer, green or red band... I really wasn't expecting all that much out of the experience aside from leaving the house and catching up with a buddy. 

But damn. 

I honestly thought this movie was great. Yes, there were parts I wasn't fond of... a bit of the dialogue seemed to me to be vulgar strictly for the sake of being vulgar... there was the usual expected Jonah Hill trademarked myriad of penis jokes and one extremely unnecessary shock gag but the majority of the movie was, to me, surprisingly satirical/smart/relevant in today's society, self-aware, and situationally hilarious. Even the dumbest and most profane of this movie's jokes and clichés seemed to know that they were such and were given the proper comedic build up/context to at least warrant a chuckle. This movie had some surprisingly clever dialogue throughout and some of the best supporting characters I've seen in recent comedies (Ice Cube, The Principal, etc..) What really stood out to me though was the editing. 21 Jump Street features some of the most awkwardly humorous camera shot transitions, scene changes and music integration. Despite it's faults, I found this to be a damn hard movie to hate, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun weekend movie.

All in all... genuine, clever, vulgar yet respectable comedy with some heart. 

IMO a very good career move for both Hill and Tatum. 

Stoked for the sequel.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":533050,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2012-04-25","keywords":"undercover cop,underage drinking,remake,buddy movie,jock","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1681366553","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwNzI4MDUzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjE4MDIwNw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwNzI4MDUzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjE4MDIwNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school in order to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1706767/","name":"Jonah Hill","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475594/","name":"Channing Tatum","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001084/","name":"Ice Cube"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0520488/","name":"Phil Lord","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0588087/","name":"Christopher Miller"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0045209/","name":"Michael Bacall","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1706767/","name":"Jonah Hill","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367895/","name":"Patrick Hasburgh"],"duration":"PT1H49M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Phil Lord, Christopher Miller

Little Fish
programme.desc: Little Fish: Directed by Chad Hartigan. With Olivia Cooke, Jack O'Connell, Soko, Raúl Castillo. A couple fights to hold their relationship together as a memory loss virus spreads and threatens to erase the history of their love and courtship." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9735470/","name":"Little Fish","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY1N2ZhMzktMThjZi00OWNhLWJhZjctMzEzNjQyOWIwZjBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple fights to hold their relationship together as a memory loss virus spreads and threatens to erase the history of their love and courtship.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9735470/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"margarida-44311"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Secret Masterpiece","reviewBody":"I wonder if the people who rated this movie actually watched until the end. I doubt it. Not because it only becomes good at the end, no. But because of how brilliant the end is. This is one of he best romances I've watched. The cinematography is beautiful as well as the music. The main actors are incredible. The moments, scenes... everything really connects in such a beautiful way. Not only I found it one of the 2020 best movies, it definitely earns a place on my top movies of all time. Highly recommend it","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3583,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"Unrated","genre":["Drama","Romance","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2021-02-05","keywords":"love","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2134032665","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjkwNzRlYmUtM2QxNC00ZWI4LWI2ZWQtYzM4Y2Q2MTQyNzhhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjkwNzRlYmUtM2QxNC00ZWI4LWI2ZWQtYzM4Y2Q2MTQyNzhhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"As a memory loss virus runs rampant, one couple fights to hold their relationship together before the disease can erase all memory of their love in this sweeping sci-fi romance."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4972453/","name":"Olivia Cooke"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1925239/","name":"Jack O'Connell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1331316/","name":"Soko"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1029961/","name":"Chad Hartigan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0323227/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319513/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0439457/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3231728/","name":"Mattson Tomlin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3798172/","name":"Aja Gabel"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Die Goldfische
Kłamstwo doskonałe
The Good Liar
programme.desc: Die Goldfische: Directed by Alireza Golafshan. With Tom Schilling, Klaas Heufer-Umlauf, Lisa Bitter, Sabrina Dietel. A good natured comedy about tax evasion and disability." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7689310/","name":"Die Goldfische","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTg2YTMyYjMtMTQ3Mi00OTU4LTlmMDEtYzQ2YjVjNWYxZDA1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDU5MDEyMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A good natured comedy about tax evasion and disability.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7689310/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pricey fish","reviewBody":"Certain things may be hard for us as viewers to connect to. Not being a banker or someone who is detached from human interaction in general, it is not easy to fully identify with the main character here. And there are flaws or at least weird decisions along the way ... but it is a comedy and it tries to be as funny as it can be overall.\n\nThat out of the way, I had no idea what the movie would be like or any story element, so color me shocked and surprised by the inciting incident at the start of the movie. I did not see that coming/happening. After that "bang" the movie takes a minute to breathe a little bit and that is the moment you see the human in our main character. Overall we get quite a few of cliches though, but still it does its best to stay on the right side of funny and delicate when it touches certain subjects. Funny but predictable - still entertaining if you let it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1680,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2019-03-21","keywords":"disability,wilhelm scream","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Die Goldfische","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3829447705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDZiZjViMDctZWE0Mi00NDdlLThjYzQtN2Q3YWQ0NjEyMmE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDZiZjViMDctZWE0Mi00NDdlLThjYzQtN2Q3YWQ0NjEyMmE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771713/","name":"Tom Schilling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1678891/","name":"Klaas Heufer-Umlauf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3474804/","name":"Lisa Bitter"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2285783/","name":"Alireza Golafshan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0027692/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0239725/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008261/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2285783/","name":"Alireza Golafshan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1487045/","name":"Justyna Müsch"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

A good natured comedy about tax evasion and disability." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7689310/","name":"Die Goldfische","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTg2YTMyYjMtMTQ3Mi00OTU4LTlmMDEtYzQ2YjVjNWYxZDA1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDU5MDEyMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A good natured comedy about tax evasion and disability.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7689310/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp","dateCreated":"2021-05-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pricey fish","reviewBody":"Certain things may be hard for us as viewers to connect to. Not being a banker or someone who is detached from human interaction in general, it is not easy to fully identify with the main character here. And there are flaws or at least weird decisions along the way ... but it is a comedy and it tries to be as funny as it can be overall.\n\nThat out of the way, I had no idea what the movie would be like or any story element, so color me shocked and surprised by the inciting incident at the start of the movie. I did not see that coming/happening. After that "bang" the movie takes a minute to breathe a little bit and that is the moment you see the human in our main character. Overall we get quite a few of cliches though, but still it does its best to stay on the right side of funny and delicate when it touches certain subjects. programme.title: Winter's Bone
Do szpiku kości
Winter's Bone
programme.desc:
Winter's Bone: Directed by Debra Granik. With Jennifer Lawrence, Isaiah Stone, Ashlee Thompson, Valerie Richards. An unflinching Ozark Mountain girl hacks through dangerous social terrain as she hunts down her drug-dealing father while trying to keep her family intact." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1399683/","name":"Winter's Bone","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0OTM3MDMxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDY1MjI0Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unflinching Ozark Mountain girl hacks through dangerous social terrain as she hunts down her drug-dealing father while trying to keep her family intact.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1399683/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Loving_Silence"},"dateCreated":"2010-08-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Haunting, Grim, but somehow Optimistic","reviewBody":"Winter's Bone is about a 17 year old girl name Rolly Dee set out to find her father who put their house for his bailbond and then vanishes. If she doesn't find him, her family will be turned out to the Ozarks. Challenging her outlaw kin's code of silence and risking her life, Ree hacks through the lies, evasions and threats offered up by her relatives and begins to piece together the truth.

Let me, just begin by saying this movie is perfectly acted. Jennifer Lawrence gives an Oscar Worthy performance as Rolly Dee. I was surprised how excellent she was, because I was sceptical of her in the "The Bill Engvall" show. But she turned me to a believer and boy, she can REALLY act. Her performance actually surpasses some of Meryl Streep's performances. Hopefully the Academy will recognize her and give an Oscar nomination or maybe even a win! The film is well directed by Debra Granik and is easily her best work yet. She definitely has potential to become the "new" Kathryn Bigelow. Anyways the film is really bleak and powerful, but it still has a tone of hopeful in it. Very interesting and mesmerizing movie to watch. It is a bit slow at times, but trust me it never gets boring or dull.

10/10 Highly recommended.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":139856,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2010-07-16","keywords":"ozark mountains,family relationships,drug trade,family crisis,search for father","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Winter's Bone","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3239184153","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0MTg3OTQzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjMxMTczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0MTg3OTQzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjMxMTczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"17 year-old Ree Dolly (Jennifer Lawrence) sets out to track down her father, who put their house up for his bail bond and then disappeared. If she doesn't find him, her family will be turned out to the Ozarks. Challenging her outlaw kin's code of silence and risking her life, Ree hacks through the lies, evasions and threats offered up by her relatives and begins to piece together the truth.

Let me, just begin by saying this movie is perfectly acted. Jennifer Lawrence gives an Oscar Worthy performance as Rolly Dee. I was surprised how excellent she was, because I was sceptical of her in the "The Bill Engvall" show. But she turned me to a believer and boy, she can REALLY act. Her performance actually surpasses some of Meryl Streep's performances. Hopefully the Academy will recognize her and give an Oscar nomination or maybe even a win! The film is well directed by Debra Granik and is easily her best work yet. She definitely has potential to become the "new" Kathryn Bigelow. Anyways the film is really bleak and powerful, but it still has a tone of hopeful in it. Very interesting and mesmerizing movie to watch. It is a bit slow at times, but trust me it never gets boring or dull.

programme.title: You Only Live Twice
Żyje się tylko dwa razy
You Only Live Twice
programme.desc:
You Only Live Twice: Directed by Lewis Gilbert. With Sean Connery, Akiko Wakabayashi, Mie Hama, Tetsurô Tanba. James Bond and the Japanese Secret Service must find and stop the true culprit of a series of space hijackings, before war is provoked between Russia and the United States." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0062512/","name":"You Only Live Twice","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc5MThlMDMtNGZhNy00ZGI5LTliYjItNmIwMzZlOTliOTNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MTk1ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"James Bond and the Japanese Secret Service must find and stop the true culprit of a series of space hijackings, before war is provoked between Russia and the United States.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0062512/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michaelarmer"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"You Only Shag Four","reviewBody":"This is another very well made Bond film, Sean Connery is up to his usual high standard, and he is ably abetted by Donald Pleasance as Blofeld, it's got all the usual trademarks, good direction, good photography, good music, and good action, particularly the Helicopter battle. It helps that they actually filmed in the places they were supposed to be at, adding quality and authenticity and with Chinese or Japanese actors, the only downside is that they were dubbed. The title song is good, by Nancy Sinatra, but not the best.

Bond Themes: - Live Intro, Silhouette Titles, Casino scene, M, Q & Moneypenny, Spectre, Cars (not Aston martins, Toyota 2000GTs instead), no Belly dancer, no Train scene and no Felix Leiter as well. Henchmen - Hans, played by Ronald Rich and someone who was just a getaway driver but turns out to be well hard, Peter Fanene Maivia from Samoa, also Miss Brandt played by Karin Dor (also a Bond Girl). Gadgets : Little Nellie

Bond Girls, there were 4 in this one, the first was in the Hong Kong intro, Ling (no. 16) played by Tsai Chin (Hong Kong), next was one of two main "Bond Girls" Aki (no.17) played by Japanese actor Akiki Wakabayashi, and very nice too, unfortunately she gets killed later. Then it was Miss Brandt (No.18), played by German actor Karin Dor (a very good actor), she was a baddie, and Bond tries to turn her, but it does not work, she tries to kill 007, making her a Henchwoman as well, but she gets it later, and lastly in this film Kissy (no. 19), the one he marries, and the best looking, she wouldn't have him at first but he nailed her at the end.

And about that marriage, Bond is supposed to have only been married once, in the next to Tracy (Diana Rigg) but he gets married here, it's said to be a fake marriage, but I don't see how, they went through the whole ceremony, the only thing that was fake was his name and his toupee, (I know its make-believe, I am just on about the characters and story), so for me Bond has been married twice and committed bigamy in OHMSS, unless they have annulled it. Oh and in one scene Henderson asks Bond if his Martini/Vodka is "Stirred not Shaken" and Bond agrees, so for true it does not matter how he takes it.

Anyway, it's another solid effort from Connery and the Bond Team, not the best but not far off, I would have given a 9 had they not dubbed most of the oriental's.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":104985,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1967-06-13","keywords":"faked death,secret headquarters,japan,ninja,secret organization","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"These Bond Women Are Changing the Spy Game","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3772365849","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzI0Yjg1NTEtNDk3Zi00MzljLTk5Y2MtNmYwYWNlMTViYzVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzI0Yjg1NTEtNDk3Zi00MzljLTk5Y2MtNmYwYWNlMTViYzVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On this IMDbrief, presented by Progressive, let's look at the evolution of the women who loved the spy, and hear from four who co-star with Daniel Craig in Bond 25."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000125/","name":"Sean Connery"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0906686/","name":"Akiko Wakabayashi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0357240/","name":"Mie Hama"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0318150/","name":"Lewis Gilbert"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0089169/","name":"Harold Jack Bloom"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001094/","name":"Roald Dahl"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001220/","name":"Ian Fleming"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0062512, Title: You Only Live Twice, --- Description: You Only Live Twice: Directed by Lewis Gilbert. With Sean Connery, Akiko Wakabayashi, Mie Hama, Tetsurô Tanba. James Bond and the Japanese Secret Service must find and stop the true culprit of a series of space hijackings, before war is provoked between Russia and the United States." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0062512/","name":"You Only Live Twice","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc5MThlMDMtNGZhNy00ZGI5LTliYjItNmIwMzZlOTliOTNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MTk1ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"James Bond and the Japanese Secret Service must find and stop the true culprit of a series of space hijackings, before war is provoked between Russia and the United States.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0062512/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"michaelarmer","dateCreated":"2020-03-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"You Only Shag Four","reviewBody":"This is another very well made Bond film, Sean Connery is up to his usual high standard, and he is ably abetted by Donald Pleasance as Blofeld, it's got all the usual trademarks, good direction, good photography, good music, and good action, particularly the Helicopter battle. It helps that they actually filmed in the places they were supposed to be at, adding quality and authenticity and with Chinese or Japanese actors, the only downside is that they were dubbed. The title song is good, by Nancy Sinatra, but not the best.

Bond Themes: - Live Intro, Silhouette Titles, Casino scene, M, Q & Moneypenny, Spectre, Cars (not Aston martins, Toyota 2000GTs instead), no Belly dancer, no Train scene and no Felix Leiter as well. Henchmen - Hans, played by Ronald Rich and someone who was just a getaway driver but turns out to be well hard, Peter Fanene Maivia from Samoa, also Miss Brandt played by Karin Dor (also a Bond Girl). Gadgets : Little Nellie

Bond Girls, there were 4 in this one, the first was in the Hong Kong intro, Ling (no. 16) played by Tsai Chin (Hong Kong), next was one of two main "Bond Girls" Aki (no.17) played by Japanese actor Akiki Wakabayashi, and very nice too, unfortunately she gets killed later. Then it was Miss Brandt (No.18), played by German actor Karin Dor (a very good actor), she was a baddie, and Bond tries to turn her, but it does not work, she tries to kill 007, making her a Henchwoman as well, but she gets it later, and lastly in this film Kissy (no. 19), the one he marries, and the best looking, she wouldn't have him at first but he nailed her at the end.

And about that marriage, Bond is supposed to have only been married once, in the next to Tracy (Diana Rigg) but he gets married here, it's said to be a fake marriage, but I don't see how, they went through the whole ceremony, the only thing that was fake was his name and his toupee, (I know its make-believe, I am just on about the characters and story), so for me Bond has been married twice and committed bigamy in OHMSS, unless they have annulled it. Oh and in one scene Henderson asks Bond if his Martini/Vodka is "Stirred not Shaken" and Bond agrees, so for true it does not matter how he takes it.

Anyway, it's another solid effort from Connery and the Bond Team, not the best but not far off, I would have given a 9 had they not dubbed most of the oriental's.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":104985,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1967-06-13","keywords":"faked death,secret headquarters,japan,ninja,secret organization","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"These Bond Women Are Changing the Spy Game","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3772365849","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzI0Yjg1NTEtNDk3Zi00MzljLTk5Y2MtNmYwYWNlMTViYzVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzI0Yjg1NTEtNDk3Zi00MzljLTk5Y2MtNmYwYWNlMTViYzVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On this IMDbrief, presented by Progressive, let's look at the evolution of the women who loved the spy, and hear from four who co-star with Daniel Craig in Bond 25.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000125/","name":"Sean Connery","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0906686/","name":"Akiko Wakabayashi","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0357240/","name":"Mie Hama"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0318150/","name":"Lewis Gilbert"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0089169/","name":"Harold Jack Bloom","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001094/","name":"Roald Dahl","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001220/","name":"Ian Fleming"],"duration":"PT1H57M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Lewis Gilbert

programme.title: Octopussy
Ośmiorniczka
Octopussy
programme.desc:
Octopussy: Directed by John Glen. With Roger Moore, Maud Adams, Louis Jourdan, Kristina Wayborn. A fake Fabergé egg, and a fellow Agent's death, lead James Bond to uncover an international jewel-smuggling operation, headed by the mysterious Octopussy, being used to disguise a nuclear attack on N.A.T.O. forces." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0086034/","name":"Octopussy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2MDE0NjE1NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjYyMzY0NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fake Fabergé egg, and a fellow Agent's death, lead James Bond to uncover an international jewel-smuggling operation, headed by the mysterious Octopussy, being used to disguise a nuclear attack on N.A.T.O. forces.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0086034/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DKosty123"},"dateCreated":"2006-10-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Best of Roger Moore's 007's","reviewBody":"I have a spot for this film. The photography on location in India & Eastern Europe is top notch. The women in this film are to me the most beautiful ones of the Bond series. Not only is Maud Adams just wonderful, but Kristina Wayborn looks great too. The action sequences in this one are among the best of the series & the humor is great. Louis Jourdan is a great bad guy & the film based upon 2 of Ian Flemings short stories put together by George MacDonald Fraser works well. This film has a pace to it, & you just can enjoy the ride when you watch it. The opening sequence has nothing to do with the rest of the film.

I often still imagine Kristina Wayborn as my girl instead of a Bond girl. The brunette in the opening sequence is a looker too. What I love about the opening is that it sets the tone for the rest of the movie. While the stunts look awesome, this film is played for a lot of laughs along with the action. It succeeds on both counts, & truly is the "Property of a Lady" with so many good looking Bond Women.

Rita Coolidge had her all time best song with the theme song for this film which seems to have been written for her voice. It's an all time high from Louis Jourdan (Kamal) to Bond in a gator tuxedo!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":102128,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1983-06-07","keywords":"time bomb,agent,faberge egg,circus,india","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3925917209","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjhiYzY2ZDYtMjIyYS00ZWEzLWE0NzktYTIyY2Q2MzVlM2I3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjhiYzY2ZDYtMjIyYS00ZWEzLWE0NzktYTIyY2Q2MzVlM2I3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000549/","name":"Roger Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000726/","name":"Maud Adams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431139/","name":"Louis Jourdan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322515/","name":"John Glen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024134/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0292129/","name":"George MacDonald Fraser"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0537363/","name":"Richard Maibaum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933865/","name":"Michael G. Wilson"}],"duration":"PT2H11M"}</script><metacontent="
